name: Stegosaurus
size: Length: Up to 9 meters, Height: Up to 4 meters, Weight: Up to 2 metric tons
fossils: Discovered in North America, Europe, and Africa
anatomical_features: Plates: Double row of bony plates along the back, Tail: Spiked tail (thagomizer), Head: Small head with a beak-like mouth
predators_and_prey: Herbivorous, may have been preyed upon by large theropods
extinction: Likely went extinct by the end of the Jurassic period

name: Brachiosaurus
size: Length: Up to 25 meters, Height: Up to 16 meters, Weight: Up to 50 metric tons
behavior: Long-necked sauropod, likely moved in herds
fossils: Discovered in North America, Africa, and Europe
anatomical_features: Neck: Long neck and tail, Head: Relatively small head, Nostrils: Nostrils on top of the head for breathing while partially submerged in water
predators_and_prey: Herbivorous, possibly preyed upon by large theropods
extinction: Likely went extinct by the end of the Jurassic period

name: Allosaurus
size: Length: Up to 12 meters, Height: Up to 4 meters, Weight: Up to 2 metric tons
behavior: Apex predator, possibly lived in small groups
anatomical_features: Head: Large head with sharp teeth, Arms: Three-fingered hands with sharp claws, Tail: Long tail for balance and agility
predators_and_prey: Predatory, preyed upon herbivorous dinosaurs
extinction: Likely went extinct by the end of the Jurassic period

name: Diplodocus
size: Length: Up to 27 meters, Height: Up to 6 meters, Weight: Up to 16 metric tons
behavior: Long-necked sauropod, likely moved in herds
anatomical_features: Neck: Long neck and tail, Head: Relatively small head
predators_and_prey: Herbivorous, possibly preyed upon by large theropods
extinction: Likely went extinct by the end of the Jurassic period

name: Archaeopteryx
size: Length: Up to 0.5 meters, Height: Up to 0.3 meters, Weight: Less than 1 kilogram
anatomical_features: Feathers: Primitive feathers, Wings: Wings with clawed fingers, Teeth: Sharp teeth
predators_and_prey: Likely hunted small animals and insects
extinction: Likely went extinct by the end of the Jurassic period

name: Ichthyosaurus
anatomical_features: Dorsal: Dorsal fin, Flippers: Flippers for swimming
predators_and_prey: Predatory, likely hunted fish and squid
extinction: Went extinct by the end of the Jurassic period

name: Ophthalmosaurus
fossils: Discovered in Europe and South America
predators_and_prey: Preyed upon fish and squid
extinction: Likely went extinct by the end of the Jurassic period

name: Plesiosaurus
fossils: Discovered in Europe and North America
anatomical_features: Long neck, Small head, Paddle-like limbs
predators_and_prey: Preyed upon fish and other marine creatures
extinction: Likely went extinct by the end of the Cretaceous period

name: Liopleurodon
predators_and_prey: Top predator preying upon fish, smaller marine reptiles, and possibly even large marine dinosaurs
extinction: Likely went extinct by the end of the Jurassic period

name: Leedsichthys

predators_and_prey: Filter-feeder consuming plankton and small marine organisms
